metadata.title: CVE-2022-20568 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In (TBD) of (TBD), there is a possible way to corrupt kernel memory due toa use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with noadditional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-220738351References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20568` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10
No subscription required
